Well-designed APIs behave consistently, fair predictably, and grow without friction. Some best practices to keep in mind are as follows:1 - Resource-oriented paths and proper use of HTTP verbs help APIs align with standard tools.2 - Use a proper API versioning approach.3 - Use standard error codes while generating API responses.4 - APIs should be idempotent. They ensure safe retries by making repeated requests to produce the same result, especially for POST operations.5 - Idempotency keys allow clients to safely deduplicate operations with side effects.6 - APIs should support pagination to prevent performance bottlenecks and payload bloat. Some common pagination strategies are offset-based, cursor-based, and keyset-based.7 - API security is mandatory for well-designed APIs. Use proper authentication and authorization with APIs using API Keys, JWTs, OAuth2, and other mechanisms. HTTPS is also a must-have for APIs running in production.

Part 3 - Chapter 1 Summary from "Building Web APIs using ASP .NET Core"في البوست اللي فات بدأنا نتكلم عن Architectures and Message Protocolsوفي Part 2 اتكلمنا عن REST كـ Architecture Style.النهارده في Part 3 هنتكلم عن SOAPSOAP = Simple Object Access Protocolهو عبارة عن Messaging Protocol لتبادل البيانات بين الأنظمة المختلفة باستخدام HTTP Protocol.Data Format المستخدم مع SOAP=> XML (Extensible Markup Language)تم تطوير SOAP لأول مرة من خلال Microsoft سنة 1999، بس لم يعتبر Standard ل Web إلا في سنة 2003 لما اعتمدته منظمة W3C كـ Recommendation.SOAP Messaging Framework Components1. SOAP Processing Modelبيحدد الـ Rules الخاصة بكيفية معالجة SOAP Messages.2. SOAP Extensible Modelبيسمح بإضافة Features جديدة للـ SOAP.أمثلة:WS-SecurityWS-AddressingWS-ReliableMessaging3. SOAP Underlying Protocol Binding Frameworkبيحدد إزاي يتم إرسال SOAP Messages من خلال بروتوكولات مختلفة زي: HTTP, SMTP, JMSمميزات SOAP» بيسمح للمطورين بتوسيع البروتوكول عن طريق إضافات زي:WS-PolicyWS-SecurityWS-Federation (لتوثيق الهوية بين الأنظمة المختلفة)» بيستخدم WSDL (Web Services Description Language)وده ملف XML بيشرح كل الـ Web Services اللي الـ Server بيقدمها وبيوضح إزاي تتعامل معاها.عيوب SOAP» بيدعم XML بس ومفيش دعم لاي Data Formate أخف زي JSON» دعم أقل من المتصفحات الحديثة لأن أغلبها مبني على REST.» أداء أقل مقارنة بـ REST لأنه بيستخدم HTTP POST وبيكون أصعب في التخزين المؤقت (Caching) من REST اللي بيدعم GET.ودي مقارنه سريعه بين REST Vs SOAP 1. Architecture StyleSOAP:بيعتمد على XML وWSDL وبيشتغل غالبا على HTTP protocol ، لكن ممكن كمان يشتغل على Protocols تانية زي SMTP.REST: Architecture Style بيعتمد على HTTP Methods (GET, POST, PUT,DELETE) وبيتعامل مع ال Resources من خلال URIs.2. Data FormateSOAP: بيدعم XML فقطREST:بيدعم أكتر من Formate  (JSON, XML, Text)  3. PerformanceSOAP:أبطأ بسبب استخدام XML وحجم الرسائل الكبير وصعب في الـ Caching.REST:أسرع وأخف، وبيستفيد من Caching خصوصًا مع HTTP GET.4. SecuritySOAP:بيدعم Security Standards قوية زي WS-Security، ومناسب للأنظمة اللي بتحتاج أمان عالي (زي البنوك).REST:بيعتمد على HTTPS وAuthentication بسيط زي OAuth و JWT  لكنه مش بنفس قوة SOAP في بعض السيناريوهات.5.DescriptionSOAP:بيستخدم WSDL (XML File) بيشرح كل تفاصيل الـ Web Service.REST:مفيش Standard واحدة، لكن ممكن نستخدم Swagger لتوثيق الـ APIs.

Ouzo-Driven Innovation: Rethinking Transformation on the Shores of Crete(Long Polish May weekend parody post ;) )As global leaders debate AI ethics and supply chain resilience, a quiet but powerful shift is happening under the Mediterranean sun. Here on Crete, I’ve spent the last few days deep-diving into a radically decentralized, ouzo-fueled innovation ecosystem — and the insights are staggering.This island isn’t just a vacation spot. It’s a next-gen sandbox for sun-powered cognitive agility. Every taverna is a use case. Every glass of ouzo? A local MVP (Minimum Viable Productivity).Key takeaways from the Cretan Tech Stack:➡️Liquid-Led Ideation: Traditional brainstorming is out. “OuzoStorming™” encourages asynchronous ideation supported by grilled squid and ambient goat sounds.➡️Decentralized Agility: Herding cats? Try herding donkeys through olive groves. The agile metaphor is alive and braying.➡️Zorba-as-a-Service (ZaaS): Local dance-based leadership rituals now drive team cohesion and real-time alignment, measured in BPM (Beats per Minute).➡️Relax-to-Earn Infrastructure: Blockchain-enhanced beach chairs allow for staking your towel and generating “Passive Leisure Yield.” Optional NFT upgrade includes a frappe.➡️Embedded UX Rituals: Every strategic lunch concludes with unsolicited raki and dessert — a UX feature that transforms customer journeys into literal sugar rushes.➡️Ambient Feline Monitoring (AFM): Strategic feline deployment (i.e. street cats) ensures continuous surveillance of sidewalk sentiment and supports natural pest control in legacy systems.➡️Wisdom-as-a-Platform (WaaP): Elderly Greek men form decentralized knowledge hubs (a.k.a. kafeneio clusters), delivering continuous, unfiltered socio-political commentary in analog format, with optional smoke signal outputs.➡️Farm-to-Framework Cuisine: Local KPIs include “Daily Freshness Index,” measured in tomato juiciness and feta salinity. Culinary ops are lean, green, and olive-oil optimized.Crete isn’t just following trends — it’s disrupting disruption itself. For anyone in BSS, FDI, AI, ESG, DEI, BYOB or just REST — this island is a must-watch.More insights to follow...after my next raki.hashtag#crete hashtag#greece hashtag#weekend hashtag#parody

آزمون رسمی CISSP چگونه است؟بخش اول : CATروش CAT (Computerized Adaptive Testing) که توسط سازمان ISC2 برای آزمون‌های CISSP و سایر گواهینامه‌ها استفاده می‌شود، یک شیوه نوین و هوشمندانه برای ارزیابی توانمندی‌های داوطلبان است. این روش با هدف افزایش دقت، کارایی و امنیت آزمون طراحی شده است. نحوه عملکرد آزمون CATدر آزمون CAT، هر داوطلب با سؤالاتی مواجه می‌شود که به‌صورت پویا و بر اساس عملکرد قبلی او انتخاب می‌شوند. فرآیند به این صورت است:1. شروع با سؤالات ساده‌تر: آزمون با سؤالی آغاز می‌شود که سطح دشواری آن پایین‌تر از حد استاندارد قبولی است.2. تنظیم سطح دشواری: پس از هر پاسخ، الگوریتم آزمون توانایی داوطلب را مجدداً ارزیابی می‌کند و بر اساس آن، سؤال بعدی را با سطح دشواری مناسب انتخاب می‌کند.3. هدف‌گیری دقت ۵۰٪: سیستم سعی می‌کند سؤالاتی ارائه دهد که احتمال پاسخ صحیح داوطلب به آن‌ها حدود ۵۰٪ باشد، تا بتواند سطح واقعی توانایی او را به‌دقت تعیین کند.4. تعیین پایان آزمون: آزمون زمانی پایان می‌یابد که سیستم با اطمینان ۹۵٪ بتواند تصمیم بگیرد که داوطلب موفق شده یا نه، یا زمانی که حداکثر تعداد سؤالات مجاز پاسخ داده شده باشد.مشخصات آزمون CISSP در قالب CAT* تعداد سؤالات: بین ۱۰۰ تا ۱۵۰ سؤال، که شامل ۲۵ سؤال آزمایشی (بدون نمره) نیز می‌شود.* حداقل سؤالات نمره‌دار: داوطلب باید حداقل به ۷۵ سؤال نمره‌دار پاسخ دهد.* مدت زمان آزمون: کاهش یافته از ۶ ساعت به حداکثر ۳ ساعتنمره قبولی: کسب حداقل ۷۰۰ از ۱۰۰۰ نمره ممکن.فرمت سؤالات: چندگزینه‌ای و سؤالات نوآورانه پیشرفته.زبان‌های موجود: انگلیسی، چینی، آلمانی، ژاپنی و اسپانیایی.مزایای استفاده از CATارزیابی دقیق‌تر و کارآمدتر: با تنظیم سطح دشواری سؤالات بر اساس عملکرد داوطلب، ارزیابی دقیق‌تری از توانمندی‌های او به‌دست می‌آید.کاهش مدت زمان آزمون: در مقایسه با آزمون‌های سنتی، CAT مدت زمان کمتری برای ارزیابی نیاز دارد. مثلا قبلا CISSP به مدت ۶ ساعت برگزار می‌شد.افزایش امنیت آزمون: با تنوع سؤالات و ترتیب آن‌ها برای هر داوطلب، احتمال تقلب کاهش می‌یابد.تجربه شخصی‌سازی‌شده برای داوطلبان: هر داوطلب با مسیر آزمونی منحصربه‌فرد مواجه می‌شود که متناسب با سطح توانایی اوست. تغییرات آینده در آزمون‌های ISC2از ۱ اکتبر ۲۰۲۵، آزمون‌های CC، CCSP و SSCP نیز به‌طور انحصاری در قالب CAT ارائه خواهند شد. تا آن زمان، این آزمون‌ها همچنان در قالب سنتی نیز در دسترس خواهند بود.hashtag#آکادمی_روزبه ارائه دهنده دوره آمادگی آزمون رسمی CISSPواتس اپ API Endpoint  This is the main URL where the request is sent. It follows the format: `baseURL/Endpoint` (e.g.http://api.example.com/users).2. Path Parameters These are used to specify a particular resource. The format is: `baseURL/Endpoint/{path-parameter}` (e.g., https://api.example.comq/users/123). For example, "123" identifies a specific user.3. Query Parameters These are used to filter or sort data. The format is: `baseURL/Endpoint?query=value` hashtag#30days_of_learninghashtag#APIs

Post Content:
🧠 𝗢𝘂𝘁-𝗼𝗳-𝗦𝗲𝗾𝘂𝗲𝗻𝗰𝗲 𝗣𝗿𝗼𝗴𝗿𝗲𝘀𝘀 – 𝗪𝗵𝗲𝗻 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗦𝗰𝗵𝗲𝗱𝘂𝗹𝗲 𝗦𝗮𝘆𝘀 "𝗔𝗵𝗲𝗮𝗱", 𝗕𝘂𝘁 𝗥𝗲𝗮𝗹𝗶𝘁𝘆 𝗦𝗮𝘆𝘀 "𝗢𝘂𝘁 𝗼𝗳 𝗖𝗼𝗻𝘁𝗿𝗼𝗹"Have you ever updated a schedule and suddenly an activity looks early, with positive float, and drops out of the critical path? But when you look closer, you realize something’s off…It likely started Out of Sequence — and that changes everything.🔹 𝗥𝗲𝗮𝗹-𝗪𝗼𝗿𝗹𝗱 𝗘𝘅𝗮𝗺𝗽𝗹𝗲: 𝗖𝗮𝗯𝗹𝗲 𝗜𝗻𝘀𝘁𝗮𝗹𝗹𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝗣𝗿𝗼𝗷𝗲𝗰𝘁Five sequential activities:A – Excavation for cables B – Procurement of cables C – Cable laying D – Backfilling E – Testing & Commissioning🔹 𝗣𝗹𝗮𝗻𝗻𝗲𝗱 𝗟𝗼𝗴𝗶𝗰 & 𝗗𝗮𝘁𝗲𝘀:A – Excavation:    1 May to 5 May B – Procurement:   1 May to 6 May C – Cable laying:   7 May to 11 May D – Backfilling:   12 May to 14 May E – Commissioning:  15 May to 16 May → Project Finish🧩 𝗟𝗼𝗴𝗶𝗰 𝗦𝗲𝗾𝘂𝗲𝗻𝗰𝗲: 𝗔 (Excavation) ↔︎𝗦𝗦↔︎ 𝗕 (Procurement) →𝗙𝗦→ 𝗖 (Cable Laying) →𝗙𝗦→ 𝗗 (Backfilling) →𝗙𝗦→ 𝗘 (Commissioning)🔹 𝗔𝗰𝘁𝘂𝗮𝗹 𝗘𝘅𝗲𝗰𝘂𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻:A – Excavation:    1 May to 7 May (delayed 2 days) B – Procurement:   1 May to 6 May C – Cable laying:   Started 5 May, Finished 10 May ← Out-of-Sequence D – Backfilling:   11 May to 13 May E – Commissioning:  14 May to 15 May → New Finish Date⚠️ 𝗪𝗵𝗮𝘁 𝗣𝗿𝗶𝗺𝗮𝘃𝗲𝗿𝗮 𝗗𝗶𝗱:• Detected C started before A finished • Marked activity C as Out-of-Sequence • Gave it positive float and removed it from the Critical Path • Updated project finish to 15 May instead of 16 MayLooks like progress... but it’s not real progress.🔗 𝗧𝗵𝗲 𝗥𝗼𝗹𝗲 𝗼𝗳 𝗥𝗲𝗹𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻𝘀𝗵𝗶𝗽𝘀 (𝗙𝗦, 𝗦𝗦, 𝗟𝗮𝗴𝘀):Logic ties are powerful — and dangerous when misused.• FS can be too strict in real-world overlapping work • Use SS + lag when sequencing allows • Always review and adjust logic after updates • Don’t assume what’s on screen reflects what’s on site🛠️ 𝗧𝗲𝗰𝗵𝗻𝗶𝗰𝗮𝗹 𝗥𝗲𝗺𝗶𝗻𝗱𝗲𝗿:Primavera won’t calculate float for completed activities. But while the activity is in progress, it can show misleading float — especially if it started out of sequence.That fake float can distort the critical path, progress metrics, and delay analysis.✅ 𝗧𝗮𝗸𝗲𝗮𝘄𝗮𝘆 𝗳𝗼𝗿 𝗣𝗹𝗮𝗻𝗻𝗲𝗿𝘀:Your job isn’t just updating dates. It’s validating logic. It’s understanding execution. And it’s knowing when the schedule looks good… but reality says otherwise.Don’t let false float fool you. Logic is everything.hashtag#PrimaveraP6 hashtag#OutOfSequence hashtag#PlanningEngineer hashtag#ScheduleLogic hashtag#ProjectControl hashtag#CriticalPath hashtag#DelayAnalysis hashtag#ConstructionScheduling hashtag#RealPlanning

Working with watchdog timers in RTOS systems brings interesting challenges.The basic idea is simple: the watchdog counts down and resets the system if it’s not reloaded in time useful to detect infinite loops or system hangs.But in multitask systems with different deadlines (e.g., one task running every 10ms, another every 100ms), feeding the watchdog from each task becomes unreliable and messy (due to timing and concurrency issues).Some alternatives I’ve explored: - Idle-priority task feeding: Since the feeder task has the lowest priority, if any higher-priority task hangs, the watchdog won’t be fed and will eventually reset the system. - Task notification system: Each task sends an “I’m alive” signal to a watchdog monitor. If one fails, you can react more precisely, like restart only the faulty task if a full system reset isn’t necessary.While reading the hashtag#ZephyrRTOS docs, i've found a great solution called Task Watchdog:It uses kernel software timers to monitor tasks and can trigger custom callback functions when a task fails to reset its own timer. We can define per-task deadlines and recovery behavior, and still fall back to the hardware watchdog if needed.I might try this feature in my Zephyr-based cruise control system if I get the time, and if so, I’ll share some of the results.

Force Majeure: Back-to-Back relevanceIn interconnected contracts, especially where you (as seller) are the intermediary, mismatched Force Majeure ("FM") clauses can leave you exposed. If your supplier is excused from performance due to an FM event, but your contract with the buyer doesn’t recognise the same event or relief, you could be held liable. The same applies if your buyer is excused from performance due to an FM event, but your contract with the seller does not recognise the same event. Why Back-to-Back FM Clauses Are Essential: 1. Risk Transfer Protection:• If a supplier invokes FM to delay or cancel delivery, the seller must also have the right to invoke FM with the buyer.• Without a back-to-back clause, the intermediary could still be liable to the buyer despite being unable to receive the goods from the supplier.Please note, this could apply similarly where the buyer invokes an FM event, where the intermediary would be liable to the supplier.2. Consistency in Legal Relief• Ensures both contracts excuse performance for the same types of unforeseen events (e.g., war, natural disasters, strikes).• Misalignment could result in one party being relieved while the other remains legally bound.3. Avoiding Commercial Gaps• For example, if the purchase contract includes pandemics as an FM event but the sale contract does not, the intermediary could be stuck with an unfulfillable obligation and no legal shield.4. Aligned Notice Requirements• Both contracts should include the same timing and method for notifying FM events.• If the supplier has 48 hours to notify but the buyer requires notice within 24 hours, the intermediary could lose the right to claim FM downstream.5. Termination Triggers• Many contracts allow termination if the FM persists beyond a certain period (e.g., 30 days).• Back-to-back durations are essential to avoid mismatched termination rights and prevent being forced into or out of a deal unfairly.Example:A trader buys steel coils from a mill in China under a contract with an FM clause that includes “natural disasters.” He sells to a European buyer under a contract without an FM clause, or without the FM clause including natural disasters as an FM event. If Chinese ports close due to an earthquake:• The supplier is excused from delivery.• The trader is still bound to deliver to the buyer or pay damages—unless the FM clause is mirrored.Conclusion:In trading and supply chain transactions, back-to-back Force Majeure clauses are not just legal formalities or boilerplate—they’re critical risk management tools. They ensure that when one party is excused from performance, the intermediary is not left exposed to penalties, claims, or losses from the other party.

Java 24 just dropped, and I took some of my saturday to dig into the changes compared to Java 23... And I have to say, it’s a solid update. One of the things I was really looking forward to was the finalization of the Foreign Function & Memory API, it basically gives Java a safe, high-performance way to interact with native code and memory, without all the clunky, error creator boilerplate of JNI. You can now allocate off-heap memory, call native libraries, and work with memory segments almost like you're in C, but with Java safety.. I also appreciate how Java 24 is going fr preview features, like unnamed variables and patterns, not sure if they are really usefull, but I like previews, lets test it.On the tooling and performance side, the improvements to the JIT compiler and the enhancements to garbage collection are things I started seeing the impact in some memory-heavy workloads. It feels like Java is becoming a more modern language without losing what made it so stable and reliable in the first place. I’m still cautious about adopting preview features in production, but I like where things are going, it’s like Java is shaking off some of its old weight while staying rock-solid for enterprise apps. I’ll definitely be using Java 24 for side projects just to explore everything more deeply.Oh, almost forgot to mention, if you wanna test the previews, use this:--enable-preview If you’re using intelij, like me, you’ll also need to enable preview features in the project settings.

DPDK, eBPF, and XDP: Their Crucial Roles in Virtual NetworkingIn virtual networking, DPDK, eBPF, and XDP each offer distinct advantages for optimizing performance, security, and observability. DPDK excels in high-performance, low-latency packet processing by bypassing the kernel, making it ideal for user-space network functions like virtual switches (OVS-DPDK) and virtual network functions (VNFs), where throughput and customizability are critical. eBPF, running in the kernel, enables efficient network observability, security policy enforcement, and deep packet inspection with minimal overhead. It is often integrated into Kubernetes CNI plugins like Cilium and Calico for network visibility and microsegmentation. XDP, built on top of eBPF, provides ultra-fast ingress filtering by executing programs directly at the NIC driver level, making it ideal for early packet filtering and load balancing, which reduces network congestion and latency in multi-tenant environments. Together, these technologies power modern cloud-native networks, providing high performance, flexible security, and granular control, particularly in virtualized environments like Kubernetes and NFV architectures.1. DPDKIdeal for virtual switches, VNFs, and edge compute gateways.Enables performance similar to hardware appliances.Extensively used in OpenStack and telecom NFV solutions.2. eBPF Powers Cilium, Tetragon, and other Kubernetes CNIs and observability tools.Integrates with Linux namespaces, cgroups, containers, and VMs.Extensible without kernel patches, supporting zero-trust security models.Limited performance vs DPDK in raw throughput.3. XDFIdeal for DDOS mitigation, early firewalling, and L4 load balancing.Reduces load on host networking stack yet important in multi-tenant environments.Limited programmability compared to full eBPF (no loops, tight instruction budget).Widely used in Cilium, Facebook Katran, and cloud CNI pipelines.hashtag#DPDK hashtag#eBPF hashtag#XDP hashtag#Cilium hashtag#Katran hashtag#CNI hashtag#Kubernetes hashtag#Tetragon hashtag#OVS

🚀 Excited to share my latest serverless project!I built a fully serverless contact form system using AWS Lambda, API Gateway, DynamoDB and SNS, eliminating the need for server management while embracing a scalable and efficient architecture.Here’s how it works:API Gateway handles form submissionsAWS Lambda processes the logic (Python)DynamoDB stores the form dataSNS sends real-time admin alertsCORS headers enable smooth frontend integrationIAM roles ensure secure, least-privilege accessThis project gave me the opportunity to build a flexible, secure, and easily scalable solution using serverless principles.What i learned: * The power of API Gateway in routing and handling form submissions with    ease: API Gateway plays a pivotal role in the entire serverless flow. It handles HTTP requests and routes them to the correct AWS Lambda function, ensuring smooth communication between the frontend and backend. This makes it an essential tool for any serverless application, as it takes care of all the necessary HTTP request and response operations without requiring traditional server management.* How Lambda can simplify backend logic without managing traditional servers:AWS Lambda enables you to run code in response to events without the need to provision or manage servers. In this project, I leveraged Lambda to handle form submissions, which allowed me to focus solely on the logic (written in Python) without worrying about underlying infrastructure. This means no need for instance scaling or server maintenance—Lambda takes care of the scaling automatically based on the number of requests, making it a powerful tool for lightweight, cost-effective solutions.* The importance of setting up CORS headers properly for seamless integration with frontend applications: Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS) is a crucial part of enabling smooth communication between a frontend (e.g., a web application) and a backend API hosted on a different domain. In this project, setting up CORS headers correctly allowed my frontend to make secure and successful API requests to the Lambda functions behind API Gateway. Without proper CORS configuration, you’d run into errors that would block requests, making the integration process a challenge. Handling CORS properly is essential for serverless architectures to work seamlessly across different domains.📝 Check out the full project walkthrough here:

Is "Consideration" still relevant in Modern Contract Law?🤔" العقود العوضية "👇🏻👇🏻👇🏻In an age of digital transactions, subscription models, and smart contracts, some might wonder: does the Doctrine of Consideration still matter?⁉️❓❓❓The answer is yes ✔️... and here's why:👇🏻⏩ The Doctrine of "Consideration" ensures that a contract reflects a mutual exchange. It's not just about promises, it's about value. Whether it's payment for a service, access to software, or even agreeing to refrain from a certain action, consideration creates the legal backbone that makes the agreement enforceable.⏩ Modern contracts may look different such as Clickwrap agreements, Software as a Service (SaaS), and Influencer Brand Deals, but the principle remains: no "Consideration", no binding contract.⏩ Even in jurisdictions exploring contract reform, the idea that both parties must give something to get something remains a key safeguard against unfair or one-sided obligations.⏩ Understanding "Consideration" is essential for legal professionals, founders, and anyone involved in "deal-making" in the digital economy.🎬 What are your thoughts on how technology is changing the way we handle contracts❓ hashtag#ContractLaw hashtag#LegalTech hashtag#DigitalContracts hashtag#ModernLaw hashtag#TechAndLaw hashtag#StartupLaw hashtag#SaaSContracts hashtag#BusinessLaw hashtag#Consideration hashtag#LegalBasicshashtag#القانون hashtag#العقود hashtag#القانون_المدني hashtag#القانون_التجاري hashtag#التحول_الرقمي hashtag#عقود_عوضية hashtag#الذكاء_الاصطناعي_والقانون hashtag#ريادة_الأعمال_القانونية hashtag#العمل_القانوني hashtag#القانون_والتكنولوجيات_الحديثة

A Note to my Fellow General Counsels: Protect Your Business First.I’ve been reviewing a lot of agreements lately and i thought to share this:When reviewing legal agreements, always begin with the end in mind. Assume realistically, that the relationship may deteriorate. Your role is to ensure your organisation is insulated when it does.One of the most critical tools in your arsenal? The termination clause.Scrutinise it. Then scrutinise the clauses that hinge on it; notice periods, payment obligations, survival provisions, dispute mechanisms. These are not boilerplate. They are strategy. Spin it in all ways till you are comfortable with the way it sounds should the relationship breakdown. Insist on the right to terminate without cause. Say it clearly: “We reserve the right to terminate this agreement at any time, without cause, by providing a 5-day written notice.” Nothing about your termination clause should be ambiguous or interpreted in a way that can give rise to a different meaning but that which you intended. Any attempt by the counterparty to dilute or eliminate this right should be met with resistance, or at minimum, renegotiated with leverage. If you’re the party with power, exercise it. If you’re not, structure flexibility into the agreement early.Termination without cause is not just a fallback. It’s your legal parachute.🪂hashtag#GeneralCounsel hashtag#LegalLeadership hashtag#ExecutiveLeadership.

🧠 Deep Dive: From Notification Failure to Protocol Insight – Debugging SCTP_SEND_FAILEDIn this post, I walk through a subtle but critical SCTP issue that emerged when handling SCTP_SEND_FAILED notifications — exploring how low-level socket events, memory layout, and system-generated notification structures like sctp_send_failed reveal the real root cause behind failed datagram delivery in production.🔍 Unpacking SCTP_SEND_FAILED: From Kernel Notification to Root CauseIn SCTP-based communication systems, handling failure gracefully is as critical as achieving successful transmission. This post traces a real-world debugging session triggered by a recurring SCTP_SEND_FAILED notification — often dismissed as a low-level socket error, but here unpacked layer by layer to reveal deep transport-level insights.We begin at the point of failure: a datagram silently dropped, triggering a structured SCTP notification. Using sctp_send_failed and its fields (ssf_type, ssf_flags, ssf_error, and ssf_info), we decode the kernel's message about why the send operation couldn't complete. We show how to safely extract this information from a raw notification buffer, interpret the semantics of each field, and map it back to application-layer intent.To go deeper, we captured traffic with Wireshark and discovered a critical clue: a heartbeat message sent from a Docker container to our system, which unexpectedly led to the abortion of the SCTP association. This insight helped correlate the SCTP_SEND_FAILED with external traffic patterns, uncovering the real trigger — an out-of-band heartbeat interpreted as a protocol violation or arriving during a teardown state.By analyzing memory handling, buffer reuse, and edge-case protocol behavior (like full receive queues or association termination), we arrived at a concrete cause — often buried deep beneath user-facing symptoms. This is a story of system-level observability, correct struct alignment, and mastering the contract between user space and kernel through precise data interpretation.Ideal for engineers working with SCTP, E2AP, or any protocol stack that depends on robust notification handling.I’d be glad to collaborate on any projects in the fields of telecommunications systems, wireless networks, network protocols, or low-level programming. If you believe my experience and skills can contribute to your work, I’d be more than happy to be part of your team — even in a small role.

Post Content:
Introducing Wizzy — a surveillance and patrolling robot I developed as part of my Tinker Lab project, designed to work in environments where traditional CCTV systems fall short.Wizzy is more than just a mobile bot. It’s a self-thinking, self-correcting system powered by a Raspberry Pi 4 — capable of intelligent patrolling, real-time decision-making, and remote monitoring. Built with flexibility and scalability in mind, Wizzy is ideal for warehouses, mid-sized factories, or secure zones where both movement and memory matter.What makes Wizzy tick:1) Smart Patrol System: Avoids getting stuck, detects patterns, and makes decisions based on sensor input2) Memory of previous states and paths: Reduces repeated loops and improves efficiency over time3) Remote Surveillance: Includes a web dashboard for manual control and camera feed access4) Real-time camera monitoring: Captures and transmits visual data during patrol5) Modular codebase: Clean Python code with multithreading and behavior modelingUnder the hood: Wizzy’s core logic is written in Python, using multithreading for non-blocking patrol control. The SmartPatrol engine implements a stateful decision system — analyzing IR sensor inputs to detect obstacles, identify stuck loops, and dynamically choose optimal turn directions. It uses pattern history (via deques), state memory, and an adaptive escape mechanism to enhance area coverage. Motion control, decision branches, and environmental feedback are abstracted for flexibility and reusability.The entire project is open-source and available here: 🔗 https://lnkd.in/dY4KyM3BThis started as a college submission — but I see it as the first step toward practical, deployable surveillance robotics.hashtag#Robotics hashtag#Automation hashtag#Surveillance hashtag#RaspberryPi hashtag#PythonProjects hashtag#CollegeProjects hashtag#SmartSecurity hashtag#EmbeddedSystems hashtag#WizzyBot hashtag#OpenSource

Username: Mohamed Hisham Abdullatif AhmedMohamed Hisham Abdullatif Ahmed
Post Content:
تعرف وش الفرق بين المصطلحات الثلاثة RID, PDC, Infrastructure في AD؟هي أدوار من ضمن ما يسمى بـ:FSMO Roles (Flexible Single Master Operations)في كل Domain داخل Active Directory، هناك 5 أدوار FSMO، ثلاثة منها تكون Domain-specific (أي لكل Domain) وهي التي سأشرحها لك، و2 تكون Forest-wide✅ 1. RID Master (Relative Identifier Master)مسؤول عن توزيع الـ RID pools (حزم الأرقام المميزة) على الـ Domain Controllers في نفس الدومين.كل حساب مستخدم أو كمبيوتر أو مجموعة في AD له SID (Security Identifier) يتكون من:SID الأساسي للدومين.رقم RID مميز لكل كائن.الـ RID Master يضمن عدم تكرار الأرقام بتوزيعها لكل DC، وكل DC يصرف من الحزمة اللي عنده.🎯 بدونه؟ لو تعطل، تقدر تشتغل لفترة، لكن لو خلصت الـRID من الـDC، ما تقدر تنشئ كائنات جديدة.✅ 2. PDC Emulator (Primary Domain Controller Emulator)هذا الدور هو الأهم بينهم.مسؤول عن:التعامل مع الأنظمة القديمة (قبل Windows 2000) التي تحتاج "PDC".تنسيق تغيير كلمات المرور بين الـDCs (إذا غير مستخدم كلمة السر، يتأكد بسرعة).يعالج Account lockouts.المصدر الأساسي لتوقيت الساعة (time source) داخل الدومين.يُعتبر المرجع لأي تغييرات تحتاج أولوية.🎯 بدونه؟ مشاكل في مزامنة كلمة المرور، ومشاكل في التوقيت، وقد تظهر أخطاء في المصادقة.✅ 3. Infrastructure Masterمسؤول عن تحديث المراجع (references) للكائنات عندما يتم تغييرها عبر الدومين.مثلاً:لديك مجموعة تحتوي على أعضاء من دومين آخر.إذا تم إعادة تسمية أو نقل عضو من الدومين الآخر، الـ Infrastructure Master يحدث المعلومة داخل الدومين.🎯 بدونه؟ قد ترى أسماء قديمة أو معلومات غير محدثة عن كائنات الدومينات الأخرى.📝 ملاحظة مهمة: إذا كان جميع الـ Domain Controllers في الدومين يعملون كـ Global Catalog (GC)، فدور الـ Infrastructure Master يصبح بلا تأثير تقريباً.🏁 خلاصة:كل واحد منهم يلعب دور محدد داخل Domain لضمان عمل Active Directory بشكل صحيح ومنسق. عادةً، يتم استضافة هذه الأدوار الثلاثة على Domain Controller واحد (خاصة في بيئات صغيرة)، لكن في بيئات كبيرة يتم توزيعها حسب الحاجة.

Well-designed APIs behave consistently, fair predictably, and grow without friction. Some best practices to keep in mind are as follows:1 - Resource-oriented paths and proper use of HTTP verbs help APIs align with standard tools.2 - Use a proper API versioning approach.3 - Use standard error codes while generating API responses.4 - APIs should be idempotent. They ensure safe retries by making repeated requests to produce the same result, especially for POST operations.5 - Idempotency keys allow clients to safely deduplicate operations with side effects.6 - APIs should support pagination to prevent performance bottlenecks and payload bloat. Some common pagination strategies are offset-based, cursor-based, and keyset-based.7 - API security is mandatory for well-designed APIs. Use proper authentication and authorization with APIs using API Keys, JWTs, OAuth2, and other mechanisms. HTTPS is also a must-have for APIs running in production.

Part 3 - Chapter 1 Summary from "Building Web APIs using ASP .NET Core"في البوست اللي فات بدأنا نتكلم عن Architectures and Message Protocolsوفي Part 2 اتكلمنا عن REST كـ Architecture Style.النهارده في Part 3 هنتكلم عن SOAPSOAP = Simple Object Access Protocolهو عبارة عن Messaging Protocol لتبادل البيانات بين الأنظمة المختلفة باستخدام HTTP Protocol.Data Format المستخدم مع SOAP=> XML (Extensible Markup Language)تم تطوير SOAP لأول مرة من خلال Microsoft سنة 1999، بس لم يعتبر Standard ل Web إلا في سنة 2003 لما اعتمدته منظمة W3C كـ Recommendation.SOAP Messaging Framework Components1. SOAP Processing Modelبيحدد الـ Rules الخاصة بكيفية معالجة SOAP Messages.2. SOAP Extensible Modelبيسمح بإضافة Features جديدة للـ SOAP.أمثلة:WS-SecurityWS-AddressingWS-ReliableMessaging3. SOAP Underlying Protocol Binding Frameworkبيحدد إزاي يتم إرسال SOAP Messages من خلال بروتوكولات مختلفة زي: HTTP, SMTP, JMSمميزات SOAP» بيسمح للمطورين بتوسيع البروتوكول عن طريق إضافات زي:WS-PolicyWS-SecurityWS-Federation (لتوثيق الهوية بين الأنظمة المختلفة)» بيستخدم WSDL (Web Services Description Language)وده ملف XML بيشرح كل الـ Web Services اللي الـ Server بيقدمها وبيوضح إزاي تتعامل معاها.عيوب SOAP» بيدعم XML بس ومفيش دعم لاي Data Formate أخف زي JSON» دعم أقل من المتصفحات الحديثة لأن أغلبها مبني على REST.» أداء أقل مقارنة بـ REST لأنه بيستخدم HTTP POST وبيكون أصعب في التخزين المؤقت (Caching) من REST اللي بيدعم GET.ودي مقارنه سريعه بين REST Vs SOAP 1. Architecture StyleSOAP:بيعتمد على XML وWSDL وبيشتغل غالبا على HTTP protocol ، لكن ممكن كمان يشتغل على Protocols تانية زي SMTP.REST: Architecture Style بيعتمد على HTTP Methods (GET, POST, PUT,DELETE) وبيتعامل مع ال Resources من خلال URIs.2. Data FormateSOAP: بيدعم XML فقطREST:بيدعم أكتر من Formate  (JSON, XML, Text)  3. PerformanceSOAP:أبطأ بسبب استخدام XML وحجم الرسائل الكبير وصعب في الـ Caching.REST:أسرع وأخف، وبيستفيد من Caching خصوصًا مع HTTP GET.4. SecuritySOAP:بيدعم Security Standards قوية زي WS-Security، ومناسب للأنظمة اللي بتحتاج أمان عالي (زي البنوك).REST:بيعتمد على HTTPS وAuthentication بسيط زي OAuth و JWT  لكنه مش بنفس قوة SOAP في بعض السيناريوهات.5.DescriptionSOAP:بيستخدم WSDL (XML File) بيشرح كل تفاصيل الـ Web Service.REST:مفيش Standard واحدة، لكن ممكن نستخدم Swagger لتوثيق الـ APIs.

Ouzo-Driven Innovation: Rethinking Transformation on the Shores of Crete(Long Polish May weekend parody post ;) )As global leaders debate AI ethics and supply chain resilience, a quiet but powerful shift is happening under the Mediterranean sun. Here on Crete, I’ve spent the last few days deep-diving into a radically decentralized, ouzo-fueled innovation ecosystem — and the insights are staggering.This island isn’t just a vacation spot. It’s a next-gen sandbox for sun-powered cognitive agility. Every taverna is a use case. Every glass of ouzo? A local MVP (Minimum Viable Productivity).Key takeaways from the Cretan Tech Stack:➡️Liquid-Led Ideation: Traditional brainstorming is out. “OuzoStorming™” encourages asynchronous ideation supported by grilled squid and ambient goat sounds.➡️Decentralized Agility: Herding cats? Try herding donkeys through olive groves. The agile metaphor is alive and braying.➡️Zorba-as-a-Service (ZaaS): Local dance-based leadership rituals now drive team cohesion and real-time alignment, measured in BPM (Beats per Minute).➡️Relax-to-Earn Infrastructure: Blockchain-enhanced beach chairs allow for staking your towel and generating “Passive Leisure Yield.” Optional NFT upgrade includes a frappe.➡️Embedded UX Rituals: Every strategic lunch concludes with unsolicited raki and dessert — a UX feature that transforms customer journeys into literal sugar rushes.➡️Ambient Feline Monitoring (AFM): Strategic feline deployment (i.e. street cats) ensures continuous surveillance of sidewalk sentiment and supports natural pest control in legacy systems.➡️Wisdom-as-a-Platform (WaaP): Elderly Greek men form decentralized knowledge hubs (a.k.a. kafeneio clusters), delivering continuous, unfiltered socio-political commentary in analog format, with optional smoke signal outputs.➡️Farm-to-Framework Cuisine: Local KPIs include “Daily Freshness Index,” measured in tomato juiciness and feta salinity. Culinary ops are lean, green, and olive-oil optimized.Crete isn’t just following trends — it’s disrupting disruption itself. For anyone in BSS, FDI, AI, ESG, DEI, BYOB or just REST — this island is a must-watch.More insights to follow...after my next raki.hashtag#crete hashtag#greece hashtag#weekend hashtag#parody

آزمون رسمی CISSP چگونه است؟بخش اول : CATروش CAT (Computerized Adaptive Testing) که توسط سازمان ISC2 برای آزمون‌های CISSP و سایر گواهینامه‌ها استفاده می‌شود، یک شیوه نوین و هوشمندانه برای ارزیابی توانمندی‌های داوطلبان است. این روش با هدف افزایش دقت، کارایی و امنیت آزمون طراحی شده است. نحوه عملکرد آزمون CATدر آزمون CAT، هر داوطلب با سؤالاتی مواجه می‌شود که به‌صورت پویا و بر اساس عملکرد قبلی او انتخاب می‌شوند. فرآیند به این صورت است:1. شروع با سؤالات ساده‌تر: آزمون با سؤالی آغاز می‌شود که سطح دشواری آن پایین‌تر از حد استاندارد قبولی است.2. تنظیم سطح دشواری: پس از هر پاسخ، الگوریتم آزمون توانایی داوطلب را مجدداً ارزیابی می‌کند و بر اساس آن، سؤال بعدی را با سطح دشواری مناسب انتخاب می‌کند.3. هدف‌گیری دقت ۵۰٪: سیستم سعی می‌کند سؤالاتی ارائه دهد که احتمال پاسخ صحیح داوطلب به آن‌ها حدود ۵۰٪ باشد، تا بتواند سطح واقعی توانایی او را به‌دقت تعیین کند.4. تعیین پایان آزمون: آزمون زمانی پایان می‌یابد که سیستم با اطمینان ۹۵٪ بتواند تصمیم بگیرد که داوطلب موفق شده یا نه، یا زمانی که حداکثر تعداد سؤالات مجاز پاسخ داده شده باشد.مشخصات آزمون CISSP در قالب CAT* تعداد سؤالات: بین ۱۰۰ تا ۱۵۰ سؤال، که شامل ۲۵ سؤال آزمایشی (بدون نمره) نیز می‌شود.* حداقل سؤالات نمره‌دار: داوطلب باید حداقل به ۷۵ سؤال نمره‌دار پاسخ دهد.* مدت زمان آزمون: کاهش یافته از ۶ ساعت به حداکثر ۳ ساعتنمره قبولی: کسب حداقل ۷۰۰ از ۱۰۰۰ نمره ممکن.فرمت سؤالات: چندگزینه‌ای و سؤالات نوآورانه پیشرفته.زبان‌های موجود: انگلیسی، چینی، آلمانی، ژاپنی و اسپانیایی.مزایای استفاده از CATارزیابی دقیق‌تر و کارآمدتر: با تنظیم سطح دشواری سؤالات بر اساس عملکرد داوطلب، ارزیابی دقیق‌تری از توانمندی‌های او به‌دست می‌آید.کاهش مدت زمان آزمون: در مقایسه با آزمون‌های سنتی، CAT مدت زمان کمتری برای ارزیابی نیاز دارد. مثلا قبلا CISSP به مدت ۶ ساعت برگزار می‌شد.افزایش امنیت آزمون: با تنوع سؤالات و ترتیب آن‌ها برای هر داوطلب، احتمال تقلب کاهش می‌یابد.تجربه شخصی‌سازی‌شده برای داوطلبان: هر داوطلب با مسیر آزمونی منحصربه‌فرد مواجه می‌شود که متناسب با سطح توانایی اوست. تغییرات آینده در آزمون‌های ISC2از ۱ اکتبر ۲۰۲۵، آزمون‌های CC، CCSP و SSCP نیز به‌طور انحصاری در قالب CAT ارائه خواهند شد. تا آن زمان، این آزمون‌ها همچنان در قالب سنتی نیز در دسترس خواهند بود.hashtag#آکادمی_روزبه ارائه دهنده دوره آمادگی آزمون رسمی CISSPواتس اپ hashtag#Day11_of_learning with BOLUWATIFE ASOKERE Day 11 was all about understanding how to structure API requests. Here’s a clear breakdown of what I learned:1. API Endpoint  This is the main URL where the request is sent. It follows the format: `baseURL/Endpoint` (e.g.http://api.example.com/users).2. Path Parameters These are used to specify a particular resource. The format is: `baseURL/Endpoint/{path-parameter}` (e.g., https://api.example.comq/users/123). For example, "123" identifies a specific user.3. Query Parameters These are used to filter or sort data. The format is: `baseURL/Endpoint?query=value` hashtag#30days_of_learninghashtag#APIs

Our newest study on "Managerial practices shaping the transformation towards artificial intelligence-enabled product–service systems" is out as hashtag#OpenAccessSome highlights:1. Focus on Digital Servitization and AI: The research highlights the significance of digital service innovation within manufacturing and the need to understand the pathways for transitioning to AI-enabled PSS, given the rapid advancement of AI technologies.2. Identification of Managerial Practices: the study investigates and identifies essential managerial practices, such as strategizing, evangelizing, and routinizing, required during different phases (preparing, conceptualizing, industrializing) of the transformation towards AI-enabled PSS, utilizing practice theory.3. Development of a Multi-Layered Path Model: The study proposes a model illustrating the interconnectedness of AI-enabled PSS, the associated technologies, and crucial ecosystem partnerships needed for a successful transformation.4. Key Case Study Insights: Findings from a case study emphasize the critical need for developing a robust digital infrastructure, integrating established system technologies, industrializing AI capabilities, and fostering ecosystem partnerships to create effective AI-enabled PSS.5. Evolutionary Process Framework: The research presents a process framework detailing the three phases of transformation (preparing, conceptualizing, industrializing) and shows how managerial practices and AI-enabled PSS evolve and interact throughout this journey.6. Theoretical Contributions: The study advances the digital servitization literature by incorporating AI into PSS frameworks, defining specific managerial practices for AI implementation, and outlining a path model critical for manufacturers moving towards autonomous solutions.Many thanks to my great co-authors, Thomas Brekke, Rimsha Naeem, David Sjödin, and Vinit Parida, for co-creating this piece. 🧠 𝗢𝘂𝘁-𝗼𝗳-𝗦𝗲𝗾𝘂𝗲𝗻𝗰𝗲 𝗣𝗿𝗼𝗴𝗿𝗲𝘀𝘀 – 𝗪𝗵𝗲𝗻 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗦𝗰𝗵𝗲𝗱𝘂𝗹𝗲 𝗦𝗮𝘆𝘀 "𝗔𝗵𝗲𝗮𝗱", 𝗕𝘂𝘁 𝗥𝗲𝗮𝗹𝗶𝘁𝘆 𝗦𝗮𝘆𝘀 "𝗢𝘂𝘁 𝗼𝗳 𝗖𝗼𝗻𝘁𝗿𝗼𝗹"Have you ever updated a schedule and suddenly an activity looks early, with positive float, and drops out of the critical path? But when you look closer, you realize something’s off…It likely started Out of Sequence — and that changes everything.🔹 𝗥𝗲𝗮𝗹-𝗪𝗼𝗿𝗹𝗱 𝗘𝘅𝗮𝗺𝗽𝗹𝗲: 𝗖𝗮𝗯𝗹𝗲 𝗜𝗻𝘀𝘁𝗮𝗹𝗹𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝗣𝗿𝗼𝗷𝗲𝗰𝘁Five sequential activities:A – Excavation for cables B – Procurement of cables C – Cable laying D – Backfilling E – Testing & Commissioning🔹 𝗣𝗹𝗮𝗻𝗻𝗲𝗱 𝗟𝗼𝗴𝗶𝗰 & 𝗗𝗮𝘁𝗲𝘀:A – Excavation:    1 May to 5 May B – Procurement:   1 May to 6 May C – Cable laying:   7 May to 11 May D – Backfilling:   12 May to 14 May E – Commissioning:  15 May to 16 May → Project Finish🧩 𝗟𝗼𝗴𝗶𝗰 𝗦𝗲𝗾𝘂𝗲𝗻𝗰𝗲: 𝗔 (Excavation) ↔︎𝗦𝗦↔︎ 𝗕 (Procurement) →𝗙𝗦→ 𝗖 (Cable Laying) →𝗙𝗦→ 𝗗 (Backfilling) →𝗙𝗦→ 𝗘 (Commissioning)🔹 𝗔𝗰𝘁𝘂𝗮𝗹 𝗘𝘅𝗲𝗰𝘂𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻:A – Excavation:    1 May to 7 May (delayed 2 days) B – Procurement:   1 May to 6 May C – Cable laying:   Started 5 May, Finished 10 May ← Out-of-Sequence D – Backfilling:   11 May to 13 May E – Commissioning:  14 May to 15 May → New Finish Date⚠️ 𝗪𝗵𝗮𝘁 𝗣𝗿𝗶𝗺𝗮𝘃𝗲𝗿𝗮 𝗗𝗶𝗱:• Detected C started before A finished • Marked activity C as Out-of-Sequence • Gave it positive float and removed it from the Critical Path • Updated project finish to 15 May instead of 16 MayLooks like progress... but it’s not real progress.🔗 𝗧𝗵𝗲 𝗥𝗼𝗹𝗲 𝗼𝗳 𝗥𝗲𝗹𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻𝘀𝗵𝗶𝗽𝘀 (𝗙𝗦, 𝗦𝗦, 𝗟𝗮𝗴𝘀):Logic ties are powerful — and dangerous when misused.• FS can be too strict in real-world overlapping work • Use SS + lag when sequencing allows • Always review and adjust logic after updates • Don’t assume what’s on screen reflects what’s on site🛠️ 𝗧𝗲𝗰𝗵𝗻𝗶𝗰𝗮𝗹 𝗥𝗲𝗺𝗶𝗻𝗱𝗲𝗿:Primavera won’t calculate float for completed activities. But while the activity is in progress, it can show misleading float — especially if it started out of sequence.That fake float can distort the critical path, progress metrics, and delay analysis.✅ 𝗧𝗮𝗸𝗲𝗮𝘄𝗮𝘆 𝗳𝗼𝗿 𝗣𝗹𝗮𝗻𝗻𝗲𝗿𝘀:Your job isn’t just updating dates. It’s validating logic. It’s understanding execution. And it’s knowing when the schedule looks good… but reality says otherwise.Don’t let false float fool you. Logic is everything.hashtag#PrimaveraP6 hashtag#OutOfSequence hashtag#PlanningEngineer hashtag#ScheduleLogic hashtag#ProjectControl hashtag#CriticalPath hashtag#DelayAnalysis hashtag#ConstructionScheduling hashtag#RealPlanning

Working with watchdog timers in RTOS systems brings interesting challenges.The basic idea is simple: the watchdog counts down and resets the system if it’s not reloaded in time useful to detect infinite loops or system hangs.But in multitask systems with different deadlines (e.g., one task running every 10ms, another every 100ms), feeding the watchdog from each task becomes unreliable and messy (due to timing and concurrency issues).Some alternatives I’ve explored: - Idle-priority task feeding: Since the feeder task has the lowest priority, if any higher-priority task hangs, the watchdog won’t be fed and will eventually reset the system. - Task notification system: Each task sends an “I’m alive” signal to a watchdog monitor. If one fails, you can react more precisely, like restart only the faulty task if a full system reset isn’t necessary.While reading the hashtag#ZephyrRTOS docs, i've found a great solution called Task Watchdog:It uses kernel software timers to monitor tasks and can trigger custom callback functions when a task fails to reset its own timer. We can define per-task deadlines and recovery behavior, and still fall back to the hardware watchdog if needed.I might try this feature in my Zephyr-based cruise control system if I get the time, and if so, I’ll share some of the results.

Force Majeure: Back-to-Back relevanceIn interconnected contracts, especially where you (as seller) are the intermediary, mismatched Force Majeure ("FM") clauses can leave you exposed. If your supplier is excused from performance due to an FM event, but your contract with the buyer doesn’t recognise the same event or relief, you could be held liable. The same applies if your buyer is excused from performance due to an FM event, but your contract with the seller does not recognise the same event. Why Back-to-Back FM Clauses Are Essential: 1. Risk Transfer Protection:• If a supplier invokes FM to delay or cancel delivery, the seller must also have the right to invoke FM with the buyer.• Without a back-to-back clause, the intermediary could still be liable to the buyer despite being unable to receive the goods from the supplier.Please note, this could apply similarly where the buyer invokes an FM event, where the intermediary would be liable to the supplier.2. Consistency in Legal Relief• Ensures both contracts excuse performance for the same types of unforeseen events (e.g., war, natural disasters, strikes).• Misalignment could result in one party being relieved while the other remains legally bound.3. Avoiding Commercial Gaps• For example, if the purchase contract includes pandemics as an FM event but the sale contract does not, the intermediary could be stuck with an unfulfillable obligation and no legal shield.4. Aligned Notice Requirements• Both contracts should include the same timing and method for notifying FM events.• If the supplier has 48 hours to notify but the buyer requires notice within 24 hours, the intermediary could lose the right to claim FM downstream.5. Termination Triggers• Many contracts allow termination if the FM persists beyond a certain period (e.g., 30 days).• Back-to-back durations are essential to avoid mismatched termination rights and prevent being forced into or out of a deal unfairly.Example:A trader buys steel coils from a mill in China under a contract with an FM clause that includes “natural disasters.” He sells to a European buyer under a contract without an FM clause, or without the FM clause including natural disasters as an FM event. If Chinese ports close due to an earthquake:• The supplier is excused from delivery.• The trader is still bound to deliver to the buyer or pay damages—unless the FM clause is mirrored.Conclusion:In trading and supply chain transactions, back-to-back Force Majeure clauses are not just legal formalities or boilerplate—they’re critical risk management tools. They ensure that when one party is excused from performance, the intermediary is not left exposed to penalties, claims, or losses from the other party.

Java 24 just dropped, and I took some of my saturday to dig into the changes compared to Java 23... And I have to say, it’s a solid update. One of the things I was really looking forward to was the finalization of the Foreign Function & Memory API, it basically gives Java a safe, high-performance way to interact with native code and memory, without all the clunky, error creator boilerplate of JNI. You can now allocate off-heap memory, call native libraries, and work with memory segments almost like you're in C, but with Java safety.. I also appreciate how Java 24 is going fr preview features, like unnamed variables and patterns, not sure if they are really usefull, but I like previews, lets test it.On the tooling and performance side, the improvements to the JIT compiler and the enhancements to garbage collection are things I started seeing the impact in some memory-heavy workloads. It feels like Java is becoming a more modern language without losing what made it so stable and reliable in the first place. I’m still cautious about adopting preview features in production, but I like where things are going, it’s like Java is shaking off some of its old weight while staying rock-solid for enterprise apps. I’ll definitely be using Java 24 for side projects just to explore everything more deeply.Oh, almost forgot to mention, if you wanna test the previews, use this:--enable-preview If you’re using intelij, like me, you’ll also need to enable preview features in the project settings.

DPDK, eBPF, and XDP: Their Crucial Roles in Virtual NetworkingIn virtual networking, DPDK, eBPF, and XDP each offer distinct advantages for optimizing performance, security, and observability. DPDK excels in high-performance, low-latency packet processing by bypassing the kernel, making it ideal for user-space network functions like virtual switches (OVS-DPDK) and virtual network functions (VNFs), where throughput and customizability are critical. eBPF, running in the kernel, enables efficient network observability, security policy enforcement, and deep packet inspection with minimal overhead. It is often integrated into Kubernetes CNI plugins like Cilium and Calico for network visibility and microsegmentation. XDP, built on top of eBPF, provides ultra-fast ingress filtering by executing programs directly at the NIC driver level, making it ideal for early packet filtering and load balancing, which reduces network congestion and latency in multi-tenant environments. Together, these technologies power modern cloud-native networks, providing high performance, flexible security, and granular control, particularly in virtualized environments like Kubernetes and NFV architectures.1. DPDKIdeal for virtual switches, VNFs, and edge compute gateways.Enables performance similar to hardware appliances.Extensively used in OpenStack and telecom NFV solutions.2. eBPF Powers Cilium, Tetragon, and other Kubernetes CNIs and observability tools.Integrates with Linux namespaces, cgroups, containers, and VMs.Extensible without kernel patches, supporting zero-trust security models.Limited performance vs DPDK in raw throughput.3. XDFIdeal for DDOS mitigation, early firewalling, and L4 load balancing.Reduces load on host networking stack yet important in multi-tenant environments.Limited programmability compared to full eBPF (no loops, tight instruction budget).Widely used in Cilium, Facebook Katran, and cloud CNI pipelines.hashtag#DPDK hashtag#eBPF hashtag#XDP hashtag#Cilium hashtag#Katran hashtag#CNI hashtag#Kubernetes hashtag#Tetragon hashtag#OVS

🚀 Excited to share my latest serverless project!I built a fully serverless contact form system using AWS Lambda, API Gateway, DynamoDB and SNS, eliminating the need for server management while embracing a scalable and efficient architecture.Here’s how it works:API Gateway handles form submissionsAWS Lambda processes the logic (Python)DynamoDB stores the form dataSNS sends real-time admin alertsCORS headers enable smooth frontend integrationIAM roles ensure secure, least-privilege accessThis project gave me the opportunity to build a flexible, secure, and easily scalable solution using serverless principles.What i learned: * The power of API Gateway in routing and handling form submissions with    ease: API Gateway plays a pivotal role in the entire serverless flow. It handles HTTP requests and routes them to the correct AWS Lambda function, ensuring smooth communication between the frontend and backend. This makes it an essential tool for any serverless application, as it takes care of all the necessary HTTP request and response operations without requiring traditional server management.* How Lambda can simplify backend logic without managing traditional servers:AWS Lambda enables you to run code in response to events without the need to provision or manage servers. In this project, I leveraged Lambda to handle form submissions, which allowed me to focus solely on the logic (written in Python) without worrying about underlying infrastructure. This means no need for instance scaling or server maintenance—Lambda takes care of the scaling automatically based on the number of requests, making it a powerful tool for lightweight, cost-effective solutions.* The importance of setting up CORS headers properly for seamless integration with frontend applications: Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS) is a crucial part of enabling smooth communication between a frontend (e.g., a web application) and a backend API hosted on a different domain. In this project, setting up CORS headers correctly allowed my frontend to make secure and successful API requests to the Lambda functions behind API Gateway. Without proper CORS configuration, you’d run into errors that would block requests, making the integration process a challenge. Handling CORS properly is essential for serverless architectures to work seamlessly across different domains.📝 Check out the full project walkthrough here:

Is "Consideration" still relevant in Modern Contract Law?🤔" العقود العوضية "👇🏻👇🏻👇🏻In an age of digital transactions, subscription models, and smart contracts, some might wonder: does the Doctrine of Consideration still matter?⁉️❓❓❓The answer is yes ✔️... and here's why:👇🏻⏩ The Doctrine of "Consideration" ensures that a contract reflects a mutual exchange. It's not just about promises, it's about value. Whether it's payment for a service, access to software, or even agreeing to refrain from a certain action, consideration creates the legal backbone that makes the agreement enforceable.⏩ Modern contracts may look different such as Clickwrap agreements, Software as a Service (SaaS), and Influencer Brand Deals, but the principle remains: no "Consideration", no binding contract.⏩ Even in jurisdictions exploring contract reform, the idea that both parties must give something to get something remains a key safeguard against unfair or one-sided obligations.⏩ Understanding "Consideration" is essential for legal professionals, founders, and anyone involved in "deal-making" in the digital economy.🎬 What are your thoughts on how technology is changing the way we handle contracts❓ hashtag#ContractLaw hashtag#LegalTech hashtag#DigitalContracts hashtag#ModernLaw hashtag#TechAndLaw hashtag#StartupLaw hashtag#SaaSContracts hashtag#BusinessLaw hashtag#Consideration hashtag#LegalBasicshashtag#القانون hashtag#العقود hashtag#القانون_المدني hashtag#القانون_التجاري hashtag#التحول_الرقمي hashtag#عقود_عوضية hashtag#الذكاء_الاصطناعي_والقانون hashtag#ريادة_الأعمال_القانونية hashtag#العمل_القانوني hashtag#القانون_والتكنولوجيات_الحديثة

A Note to my Fellow General Counsels: Protect Your Business First.I’ve been reviewing a lot of agreements lately and i thought to share this:When reviewing legal agreements, always begin with the end in mind. Assume realistically, that the relationship may deteriorate. Your role is to ensure your organisation is insulated when it does.One of the most critical tools in your arsenal? The termination clause.Scrutinise it. Then scrutinise the clauses that hinge on it; notice periods, payment obligations, survival provisions, dispute mechanisms. These are not boilerplate. They are strategy. Spin it in all ways till you are comfortable with the way it sounds should the relationship breakdown. Insist on the right to terminate without cause. Say it clearly: “We reserve the right to terminate this agreement at any time, without cause, by providing a 5-day written notice.” Nothing about your termination clause should be ambiguous or interpreted in a way that can give rise to a different meaning but that which you intended. Any attempt by the counterparty to dilute or eliminate this right should be met with resistance, or at minimum, renegotiated with leverage. If you’re the party with power, exercise it. If you’re not, structure flexibility into the agreement early.Termination without cause is not just a fallback. It’s your legal parachute.🪂hashtag#GeneralCounsel hashtag#LegalLeadership hashtag#ExecutiveLeadership.

🧠 Deep Dive: From Notification Failure to Protocol Insight – Debugging SCTP_SEND_FAILEDIn this post, I walk through a subtle but critical SCTP issue that emerged when handling SCTP_SEND_FAILED notifications — exploring how low-level socket events, memory layout, and system-generated notification structures like sctp_send_failed reveal the real root cause behind failed datagram delivery in production.🔍 Unpacking SCTP_SEND_FAILED: From Kernel Notification to Root CauseIn SCTP-based communication systems, handling failure gracefully is as critical as achieving successful transmission. This post traces a real-world debugging session triggered by a recurring SCTP_SEND_FAILED notification — often dismissed as a low-level socket error, but here unpacked layer by layer to reveal deep transport-level insights.We begin at the point of failure: a datagram silently dropped, triggering a structured SCTP notification. Using sctp_send_failed and its fields (ssf_type, ssf_flags, ssf_error, and ssf_info), we decode the kernel's message about why the send operation couldn't complete. We show how to safely extract this information from a raw notification buffer, interpret the semantics of each field, and map it back to application-layer intent.To go deeper, we captured traffic with Wireshark and discovered a critical clue: a heartbeat message sent from a Docker container to our system, which unexpectedly led to the abortion of the SCTP association. This insight helped correlate the SCTP_SEND_FAILED with external traffic patterns, uncovering the real trigger — an out-of-band heartbeat interpreted as a protocol violation or arriving during a teardown state.By analyzing memory handling, buffer reuse, and edge-case protocol behavior (like full receive queues or association termination), we arrived at a concrete cause — often buried deep beneath user-facing symptoms. This is a story of system-level observability, correct struct alignment, and mastering the contract between user space and kernel through precise data interpretation.Ideal for engineers working with SCTP, E2AP, or any protocol stack that depends on robust notification handling.I’d be glad to collaborate on any projects in the fields of telecommunications systems, wireless networks, network protocols, or low-level programming. If you believe my experience and skills can contribute to your work, I’d be more than happy to be part of your team — even in a small role.

Post Content:
Introducing Wizzy — a surveillance and patrolling robot I developed as part of my Tinker Lab project, designed to work in environments where traditional CCTV systems fall short.Wizzy is more than just a mobile bot. It’s a self-thinking, self-correcting system powered by a Raspberry Pi 4 — capable of intelligent patrolling, real-time decision-making, and remote monitoring. Built with flexibility and scalability in mind, Wizzy is ideal for warehouses, mid-sized factories, or secure zones where both movement and memory matter.What makes Wizzy tick:1) Smart Patrol System: Avoids getting stuck, detects patterns, and makes decisions based on sensor input2) Memory of previous states and paths: Reduces repeated loops and improves efficiency over time3) Remote Surveillance: Includes a web dashboard for manual control and camera feed access4) Real-time camera monitoring: Captures and transmits visual data during patrol5) Modular codebase: Clean Python code with multithreading and behavior modelingUnder the hood: Wizzy’s core logic is written in Python, using multithreading for non-blocking patrol control. The SmartPatrol engine implements a stateful decision system — analyzing IR sensor inputs to detect obstacles, identify stuck loops, and dynamically choose optimal turn directions. It uses pattern history (via deques), state memory, and an adaptive escape mechanism to enhance area coverage. Motion control, decision branches, and environmental feedback are abstracted for flexibility and reusability.The entire project is open-source and available here: 🔗 https://lnkd.in/dY4KyM3BThis started as a college submission — but I see it as the first step toward practical, deployable surveillance robotics.hashtag#Robotics hashtag#Automation hashtag#Surveillance hashtag#RaspberryPi hashtag#PythonProjects hashtag#CollegeProjects hashtag#SmartSecurity hashtag#EmbeddedSystems hashtag#WizzyBot hashtag#OpenSource

Username: Mohamed Hisham Abdullatif AhmedMohamed Hisham Abdullatif Ahmed
Post Content:
تعرف وش الفرق بين المصطلحات الثلاثة RID, PDC, Infrastructure في AD؟هي أدوار من ضمن ما يسمى بـ:FSMO Roles (Flexible Single Master Operations)في كل Domain داخل Active Directory، هناك 5 أدوار FSMO، ثلاثة منها تكون Domain-specific (أي لكل Domain) وهي التي سأشرحها لك، و2 تكون Forest-wide✅ 1. RID Master (Relative Identifier Master)مسؤول عن توزيع الـ RID pools (حزم الأرقام المميزة) على الـ Domain Controllers في نفس الدومين.كل حساب مستخدم أو كمبيوتر أو مجموعة في AD له SID (Security Identifier) يتكون من:SID الأساسي للدومين.رقم RID مميز لكل كائن.الـ RID Master يضمن عدم تكرار الأرقام بتوزيعها لكل DC، وكل DC يصرف من الحزمة اللي عنده.🎯 بدونه؟ لو تعطل، تقدر تشتغل لفترة، لكن لو خلصت الـRID من الـDC، ما تقدر تنشئ كائنات جديدة.✅ 2. PDC Emulator (Primary Domain Controller Emulator)هذا الدور هو الأهم بينهم.مسؤول عن:التعامل مع الأنظمة القديمة (قبل Windows 2000) التي تحتاج "PDC".تنسيق تغيير كلمات المرور بين الـDCs (إذا غير مستخدم كلمة السر، يتأكد بسرعة).يعالج Account lockouts.المصدر الأساسي لتوقيت الساعة (time source) داخل الدومين.يُعتبر المرجع لأي تغييرات تحتاج أولوية.🎯 بدونه؟ مشاكل في مزامنة كلمة المرور، ومشاكل في التوقيت، وقد تظهر أخطاء في المصادقة.✅ 3. Infrastructure Masterمسؤول عن تحديث المراجع (references) للكائنات عندما يتم تغييرها عبر الدومين.مثلاً:لديك مجموعة تحتوي على أعضاء من دومين آخر.إذا تم إعادة تسمية أو نقل عضو من الدومين الآخر، الـ Infrastructure Master يحدث المعلومة داخل الدومين.🎯 بدونه؟ قد ترى أسماء قديمة أو معلومات غير محدثة عن كائنات الدومينات الأخرى.📝 ملاحظة مهمة: إذا كان جميع الـ Domain Controllers في الدومين يعملون كـ Global Catalog (GC)، فدور الـ Infrastructure Master يصبح بلا تأثير تقريباً.🏁 خلاصة:كل واحد منهم يلعب دور محدد داخل Domain لضمان عمل Active Directory بشكل صحيح ومنسق. عادةً، يتم استضافة هذه الأدوار الثلاثة على Domain Controller واحد (خاصة في بيئات صغيرة)، لكن في بيئات كبيرة يتم توزيعها حسب الحاجة.

Well-designed APIs behave consistently, fair predictably, and grow without friction. Some best practices to keep in mind are as follows:1 - Resource-oriented paths and proper use of HTTP verbs help APIs align with standard tools.2 - Use a proper API versioning approach.3 - Use standard error codes while generating API responses.4 - APIs should be idempotent. They ensure safe retries by making repeated requests to produce the same result, especially for POST operations.5 - Idempotency keys allow clients to safely deduplicate operations with side effects.6 - APIs should support pagination to prevent performance bottlenecks and payload bloat. Some common pagination strategies are offset-based, cursor-based, and keyset-based.7 - API security is mandatory for well-designed APIs. Use proper authentication and authorization with APIs using API Keys, JWTs, OAuth2, and other mechanisms. HTTPS is also a must-have for APIs running in production.

Part 3 - Chapter 1 Summary from "Building Web APIs using ASP .NET Core"في البوست اللي فات بدأنا نتكلم عن Architectures and Message Protocolsوفي Part 2 اتكلمنا عن REST كـ Architecture Style.النهارده في Part 3 هنتكلم عن SOAPSOAP = Simple Object Access Protocolهو عبارة عن Messaging Protocol لتبادل البيانات بين الأنظمة المختلفة باستخدام HTTP Protocol.Data Format المستخدم مع SOAP=> XML (Extensible Markup Language)تم تطوير SOAP لأول مرة من خلال Microsoft سنة 1999، بس لم يعتبر Standard ل Web إلا في سنة 2003 لما اعتمدته منظمة W3C كـ Recommendation.SOAP Messaging Framework Components1. SOAP Processing Modelبيحدد الـ Rules الخاصة بكيفية معالجة SOAP Messages.2. SOAP Extensible Modelبيسمح بإضافة Features جديدة للـ SOAP.أمثلة:WS-SecurityWS-AddressingWS-ReliableMessaging3. SOAP Underlying Protocol Binding Frameworkبيحدد إزاي يتم إرسال SOAP Messages من خلال بروتوكولات مختلفة زي: HTTP, SMTP, JMSمميزات SOAP» بيسمح للمطورين بتوسيع البروتوكول عن طريق إضافات زي:WS-PolicyWS-SecurityWS-Federation (لتوثيق الهوية بين الأنظمة المختلفة)» بيستخدم WSDL (Web Services Description Language)وده ملف XML بيشرح كل الـ Web Services اللي الـ Server بيقدمها وبيوضح إزاي تتعامل معاها.عيوب SOAP» بيدعم XML بس ومفيش دعم لاي Data Formate أخف زي JSON» دعم أقل من المتصفحات الحديثة لأن أغلبها مبني على REST.» أداء أقل مقارنة بـ REST لأنه بيستخدم HTTP POST وبيكون أصعب في التخزين المؤقت (Caching) من REST اللي بيدعم GET.ودي مقارنه سريعه بين REST Vs SOAP 1. Architecture StyleSOAP:بيعتمد على XML وWSDL وبيشتغل غالبا على HTTP protocol ، لكن ممكن كمان يشتغل على Protocols تانية زي SMTP.REST: Architecture Style بيعتمد على HTTP Methods (GET, POST, PUT,DELETE) وبيتعامل مع ال Resources من خلال URIs.2. Data FormateSOAP: بيدعم XML فقطREST:بيدعم أكتر من Formate  (JSON, XML, Text)  3. PerformanceSOAP:أبطأ بسبب استخدام XML وحجم الرسائل الكبير وصعب في الـ Caching.REST:أسرع وأخف، وبيستفيد من Caching خصوصًا مع HTTP GET.4. SecuritySOAP:بيدعم Security Standards قوية زي WS-Security، ومناسب للأنظمة اللي بتحتاج أمان عالي (زي البنوك).REST:بيعتمد على HTTPS وAuthentication بسيط زي OAuth و JWT  لكنه مش بنفس قوة SOAP في بعض السيناريوهات.5.DescriptionSOAP:بيستخدم WSDL (XML File) بيشرح كل تفاصيل الـ Web Service.REST:مفيش Standard واحدة، لكن ممكن نستخدم Swagger لتوثيق الـ APIs.

Ouzo-Driven Innovation: Rethinking Transformation on the Shores of Crete(Long Polish May weekend parody post ;) )As global leaders debate AI ethics and supply chain resilience, a quiet but powerful shift is happening under the Mediterranean sun. Here on Crete, I’ve spent the last few days deep-diving into a radically decentralized, ouzo-fueled innovation ecosystem — and the insights are staggering.This island isn’t just a vacation spot. It’s a next-gen sandbox for sun-powered cognitive agility. Every taverna is a use case. Every glass of ouzo? A local MVP (Minimum Viable Productivity).Key takeaways from the Cretan Tech Stack:➡️Liquid-Led Ideation: Traditional brainstorming is out. “OuzoStorming™” encourages asynchronous ideation supported by grilled squid and ambient goat sounds.➡️Decentralized Agility: Herding cats? Try herding donkeys through olive groves. The agile metaphor is alive and braying.➡️Zorba-as-a-Service (ZaaS): Local dance-based leadership rituals now drive team cohesion and real-time alignment, measured in BPM (Beats per Minute).➡️Relax-to-Earn Infrastructure: Blockchain-enhanced beach chairs allow for staking your towel and generating “Passive Leisure Yield.” Optional NFT upgrade includes a frappe.➡️Embedded UX Rituals: Every strategic lunch concludes with unsolicited raki and dessert — a UX feature that transforms customer journeys into literal sugar rushes.➡️Ambient Feline Monitoring (AFM): Strategic feline deployment (i.e. street cats) ensures continuous surveillance of sidewalk sentiment and supports natural pest control in legacy systems.➡️Wisdom-as-a-Platform (WaaP): Elderly Greek men form decentralized knowledge hubs (a.k.a. kafeneio clusters), delivering continuous, unfiltered socio-political commentary in analog format, with optional smoke signal outputs.➡️Farm-to-Framework Cuisine: Local KPIs include “Daily Freshness Index,” measured in tomato juiciness and feta salinity. Culinary ops are lean, green, and olive-oil optimized.Crete isn’t just following trends — it’s disrupting disruption itself. For anyone in BSS, FDI, AI, ESG, DEI, BYOB or just REST — this island is a must-watch.More insights to follow...after my next raki.hashtag#crete hashtag#greece hashtag#weekend hashtag#parody

آزمون رسمی CISSP چگونه است؟بخش اول : CATروش CAT (Computerized Adaptive Testing) که توسط سازمان ISC2 برای آزمون‌های CISSP و سایر گواهینامه‌ها استفاده می‌شود، یک شیوه نوین و هوشمندانه برای ارزیابی توانمندی‌های داوطلبان است. این روش با هدف افزایش دقت، کارایی و امنیت آزمون طراحی شده است. نحوه عملکرد آزمون CATدر آزمون CAT، هر داوطلب با سؤالاتی مواجه می‌شود که به‌صورت پویا و بر اساس عملکرد قبلی او انتخاب می‌شوند. فرآیند به این صورت است:1. شروع با سؤالات ساده‌تر: آزمون با سؤالی آغاز می‌شود که سطح دشواری آن پایین‌تر از حد استاندارد قبولی است.2. تنظیم سطح دشواری: پس از هر پاسخ، الگوریتم آزمون توانایی داوطلب را مجدداً ارزیابی می‌کند و بر اساس آن، سؤال بعدی را با سطح دشواری مناسب انتخاب می‌کند.3. هدف‌گیری دقت ۵۰٪: سیستم سعی می‌کند سؤالاتی ارائه دهد که احتمال پاسخ صحیح داوطلب به آن‌ها حدود ۵۰٪ باشد، تا بتواند سطح واقعی توانایی او را به‌دقت تعیین کند.4. تعیین پایان آزمون: آزمون زمانی پایان می‌یابد که سیستم با اطمینان ۹۵٪ بتواند تصمیم بگیرد که داوطلب موفق شده یا نه، یا زمانی که حداکثر تعداد سؤالات مجاز پاسخ داده شده باشد.مشخصات آزمون CISSP در قالب CAT* تعداد سؤالات: بین ۱۰۰ تا ۱۵۰ سؤال، که شامل ۲۵ سؤال آزمایشی (بدون نمره) نیز می‌شود.* حداقل سؤالات نمره‌دار: داوطلب باید حداقل به ۷۵ سؤال نمره‌دار پاسخ دهد.* مدت زمان آزمون: کاهش یافته از ۶ ساعت به حداکثر ۳ ساعتنمره قبولی: کسب حداقل ۷۰۰ از ۱۰۰۰ نمره ممکن.فرمت سؤالات: چندگزینه‌ای و سؤالات نوآورانه پیشرفته.زبان‌های موجود: انگلیسی، چینی، آلمانی، ژاپنی و اسپانیایی.مزایای استفاده از CATارزیابی دقیق‌تر و کارآمدتر: با تنظیم سطح دشواری سؤالات بر اساس عملکرد داوطلب، ارزیابی دقیق‌تری از توانمندی‌های او به‌دست می‌آید.کاهش مدت زمان آزمون: در مقایسه با آزمون‌های سنتی، CAT مدت زمان کمتری برای ارزیابی نیاز دارد. مثلا قبلا CISSP به مدت ۶ ساعت برگزار می‌شد.افزایش امنیت آزمون: با تنوع سؤالات و ترتیب آن‌ها برای هر داوطلب، احتمال تقلب کاهش می‌یابد.تجربه شخصی‌سازی‌شده برای داوطلبان: هر داوطلب با مسیر آزمونی منحصربه‌فرد مواجه می‌شود که متناسب با سطح توانایی اوست. تغییرات آینده در آزمون‌های ISC2از ۱ اکتبر ۲۰۲۵، آزمون‌های CC، CCSP و SSCP نیز به‌طور انحصاری در قالب CAT ارائه خواهند شد. تا آن زمان، این آزمون‌ها همچنان در قالب سنتی نیز در دسترس خواهند بود.hashtag#آکادمی_روزبه ارائه دهنده دوره آمادگی آزمون رسمی CISSPواتس اپ hashtag#Day11_of_learning with BOLUWATIFE ASOKERE Day 11 was all about understanding how to structure API requests. Here’s a clear breakdown of what I learned:1. API Endpoint  This is the main URL where the request is sent. It follows the format: `baseURL/Endpoint` (e.g.http://api.example.com/users).2. Path Parameters These are used to specify a particular resource. The format is: `baseURL/Endpoint/{path-parameter}` (e.g., https://api.example.comq/users/123). For example, "123" identifies a specific user.3. Query Parameters These are used to filter or sort data. The format is: `baseURL/Endpoint?query=value` hashtag#30days_of_learninghashtag#APIs

Our newest study on "Managerial practices shaping the transformation towards artificial intelligence-enabled product–service systems" is out as hashtag#OpenAccessSome highlights:1. Focus on Digital Servitization and AI: The research highlights the significance of digital service innovation within manufacturing and the need to understand the pathways for transitioning to AI-enabled PSS, given the rapid advancement of AI technologies.2. Identification of Managerial Practices: the study investigates and identifies essential managerial practices, such as strategizing, evangelizing, and routinizing, required during different phases (preparing, conceptualizing, industrializing) of the transformation towards AI-enabled PSS, utilizing practice theory.3. Development of a Multi-Layered Path Model: The study proposes a model illustrating the interconnectedness of AI-enabled PSS, the associated technologies, and crucial ecosystem partnerships needed for a successful transformation.4. Key Case Study Insights: Findings from a case study emphasize the critical need for developing a robust digital infrastructure, integrating established system technologies, industrializing AI capabilities, and fostering ecosystem partnerships to create effective AI-enabled PSS.5. Evolutionary Process Framework: The research presents a process framework detailing the three phases of transformation (preparing, conceptualizing, industrializing) and shows how managerial practices and AI-enabled PSS evolve and interact throughout this journey.6. Theoretical Contributions: The study advances the digital servitization literature by incorporating AI into PSS frameworks, defining specific managerial practices for AI implementation, and outlining a path model critical for manufacturers moving towards autonomous solutions.Many thanks to my great co-authors, Thomas Brekke, Rimsha Naeem, David Sjödin, and Vinit Parida, for co-creating this piece. Also, many thanks to the reviewers, special Issue editors, and International Journal of Production Economics.hashtag#ArtificialIntelligence hashtag#AI hashtag#servitization hashtag#servitization hashtag#PSS hashtag#BusinessModel hashtag#AutonomousSolutionsUniversity of Vaasa Strategic Business Development Research Group (SBD), University of Vaasa

مدیریت خطاهای زنجیره‌ای در میکروسرویس‌ها | Circuit Breaker با Polly در عملتا حالا شده یه سرویس از کار بیفته و باعث بشه کل سیستم پشت سرش قفل کنه؟ما دقیقاً با همین مشکل روبه‌رو بودیم...توی سیستم‌های میکروسرویسی، گاهی یه خطای ساده مثل دومینو میتونه تمام سرویس‌ها رو پشت‌سر هم از کار بندازه. مخصوصاً وقتی اجرای یک سرویس به پاسخ موفق سرویس بعدی وابسته باشه و درخواست‌ها پشت‌سرهم صف بکشن.💡 اینجا بود که فهمیدیم به مکانیزمی نیاز داریم که بتونه سریعاً جلوی خطاهای پشت‌سرهم رو بگیره و مانع از فشار بیشتر روی کل سیستم بشه.🔌 راه‌حل ما: Circuit Breaker Patternیه مکانیزم طراحی کردیم که:🔸 وقتی یه سرویس چند بار پشت سر هم خطا داد، موقتاً از مدار خارج بشه.🔸 درخواست‌های جدید بهش ارسال نشن و بجاش فوراً به کاربر یه خطای کنترل‌ شده برگردونیم.🔸 بعد از گذشت یه مدت، مدار رو به‌صورت آزمایشی (حالت Half-Open) فعال کنیم تا ببینیم مشکل رفع شده یا نه.🛠️ ابزارمون چی بود؟ Polly (در دات‌نت)برای پیاده‌سازی Circuit Breaker از کتابخونه‌ی Polly استفاده کردیم، که هم قدرتمنده و هم استفاده ازش خیلی راحته. اینجا Polly بهمون کمک کرد:🔹 تعداد خطاهای مجاز و مدت زمان باز بودن مدار رو به‌سادگی تنظیم کنیم.🔹 میشه Circuit Breaker رو با Retry و Timeout ترکیب کنیم تا مدیریت خطاها بهتر بشه.🔹 وضعیت خطاها و مدارها رو دقیق لاگ‌گیری و مانیتور کنیم.🧠 مهم‌ترین تجربه‌ای که به دست آوردیم:✅ همه خطاها Retry نمی‌خوان! بعضی وقت‌ها باید قبول کنیم الان زمان retry نیست، بلکه باید مدار رو قطع کنیم.✅  و Circuit Breaker به ما کمک کرد که: 🔹 جلوی overload شدن سرویس‌های مشکل‌دار رو بگیریم. 🔹 بقیه‌ی بخش‌های سیستم رو پایدار نگه داریم. 🔹 خطاها رو ساده‌تر تشخیص بدیم و سریع‌تر واکنش نشون بدیم.📌 نکته مهم: پس Circuit Breaker فقط یه ابزار نیست، یه نگرشه که کمک میکنه طراحی سیستم‌مون از اساس resilient بشه. یعنی بپذیریم که «خطا همیشه وجود داره»، ولی ما می‌تونیم مدیریتش کنیم.❓ شما از Circuit Breaker استفاده کردید؟ با Polly تجربه‌ای داشتید، یا از ابزارهای دیگه استفاده کردید؟ خیلی خوشحال میشم نظرتون رو بدونم 🙌hashtag#Microservices hashtag#CircuitBreaker hashtag#Polly hashtag#Resilience hashtag#FaultTolerance hashtag#DistributedSystems hashtag#SoftwareArchitecture hashtag#SystemDesign hashtag#Scalability

🧠 𝗢𝘂𝘁-𝗼𝗳-𝗦𝗲𝗾𝘂𝗲𝗻𝗰𝗲 𝗣𝗿𝗼𝗴𝗿𝗲𝘀𝘀 – 𝗪𝗵𝗲𝗻 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗦𝗰𝗵𝗲𝗱𝘂𝗹𝗲 𝗦𝗮𝘆𝘀 "𝗔𝗵𝗲𝗮𝗱", 𝗕𝘂𝘁 𝗥𝗲𝗮𝗹𝗶𝘁𝘆 𝗦𝗮𝘆𝘀 "𝗢𝘂𝘁 𝗼𝗳 𝗖𝗼𝗻𝘁𝗿𝗼𝗹"Have you ever updated a schedule and suddenly an activity looks early, with positive float, and drops out of the critical path? But when you look closer, you realize something’s off…It likely started Out of Sequence — and that changes everything.🔹 𝗥𝗲𝗮𝗹-𝗪𝗼𝗿𝗹𝗱 𝗘𝘅𝗮𝗺𝗽𝗹𝗲: 𝗖𝗮𝗯𝗹𝗲 𝗜𝗻𝘀𝘁𝗮𝗹𝗹𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝗣𝗿𝗼𝗷𝗲𝗰𝘁Five sequential activities:A – Excavation for cables B – Procurement of cables C – Cable laying D – Backfilling E – Testing & Commissioning🔹 𝗣𝗹𝗮𝗻𝗻𝗲𝗱 𝗟𝗼𝗴𝗶𝗰 & 𝗗𝗮𝘁𝗲𝘀:A – Excavation:    1 May to 5 May B – Procurement:   1 May to 6 May C – Cable laying:   7 May to 11 May D – Backfilling:   12 May to 14 May E – Commissioning:  15 May to 16 May → Project Finish🧩 𝗟𝗼𝗴𝗶𝗰 𝗦𝗲𝗾𝘂𝗲𝗻𝗰𝗲: 𝗔 (Excavation) ↔︎𝗦𝗦↔︎ 𝗕 (Procurement) →𝗙𝗦→ 𝗖 (Cable Laying) →𝗙𝗦→ 𝗗 (Backfilling) →𝗙𝗦→ 𝗘 (Commissioning)🔹 𝗔𝗰𝘁𝘂𝗮𝗹 𝗘𝘅𝗲𝗰𝘂𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻:A – Excavation:    1 May to 7 May (delayed 2 days) B – Procurement:   1 May to 6 May C – Cable laying:   Started 5 May, Finished 10 May ← Out-of-Sequence D – Backfilling:   11 May to 13 May E – Commissioning:  14 May to 15 May → New Finish Date⚠️ 𝗪𝗵𝗮𝘁 𝗣𝗿𝗶𝗺𝗮𝘃𝗲𝗿𝗮 𝗗𝗶𝗱:• Detected C started before A finished • Marked activity C as Out-of-Sequence • Gave it positive float and removed it from the Critical Path • Updated project finish to 15 May instead of 16 MayLooks like progress... but it’s not real progress.🔗 𝗧𝗵𝗲 𝗥𝗼𝗹𝗲 𝗼𝗳 𝗥𝗲𝗹𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻𝘀𝗵𝗶𝗽𝘀 (𝗙𝗦, 𝗦𝗦, 𝗟𝗮𝗴𝘀):Logic ties are powerful — and dangerous when misused.• FS can be too strict in real-world overlapping work • Use SS + lag when sequencing allows • Always review and adjust logic after updates • Don’t assume what’s on screen reflects what’s on site🛠️ 𝗧𝗲𝗰𝗵𝗻𝗶𝗰𝗮𝗹 𝗥𝗲𝗺𝗶𝗻𝗱𝗲𝗿:Primavera won’t calculate float for completed activities. But while the activity is in progress, it can show misleading float — especially if it started out of sequence.That fake float can distort the critical path, progress metrics, and delay analysis.✅ 𝗧𝗮𝗸𝗲𝗮𝘄𝗮𝘆 𝗳𝗼𝗿 𝗣𝗹𝗮𝗻𝗻𝗲𝗿𝘀:Your job isn’t just updating dates. It’s validating logic. It’s understanding execution. And it’s knowing when the schedule looks good… but reality says otherwise.Don’t let false float fool you. Logic is everything.hashtag#PrimaveraP6 hashtag#OutOfSequence hashtag#PlanningEngineer hashtag#ScheduleLogic hashtag#ProjectControl hashtag#CriticalPath hashtag#DelayAnalysis hashtag#ConstructionScheduling hashtag#RealPlanning

Working with watchdog timers in RTOS systems brings interesting challenges.The basic idea is simple: the watchdog counts down and resets the system if it’s not reloaded in time useful to detect infinite loops or system hangs.But in multitask systems with different deadlines (e.g., one task running every 10ms, another every 100ms), feeding the watchdog from each task becomes unreliable and messy (due to timing and concurrency issues).Some alternatives I’ve explored: - Idle-priority task feeding: Since the feeder task has the lowest priority, if any higher-priority task hangs, the watchdog won’t be fed and will eventually reset the system. - Task notification system: Each task sends an “I’m alive” signal to a watchdog monitor. If one fails, you can react more precisely, like restart only the faulty task if a full system reset isn’t necessary.While reading the hashtag#ZephyrRTOS docs, i've found a great solution called Task Watchdog:It uses kernel software timers to monitor tasks and can trigger custom callback functions when a task fails to reset its own timer. We can define per-task deadlines and recovery behavior, and still fall back to the hardware watchdog if needed.I might try this feature in my Zephyr-based cruise control system if I get the time, and if so, I’ll share some of the results.
